name: Smiths Beach Resort

reviews.text: We stayed at the resort with our 7-month old daughter in a 1 bedroom poolside villa. We loved it so much we extended our stay. This place has everything--clean and modern rooms, full kitchen, beach, pool, proximity to wineries, etc...
reviews.title: Wish we were still there!

reviews.text: The staff were really friendly and knowledgeable. They put us in-touch with a fantastic babysitting service so we could have a parents day out exploring the wineries without the baby.
reviews.title: Beautiful self catered accommodation

reviews.text: The only complaint is that their Internet is horribly slow and expensive. I ended up driving to nearby Dunsborough to use an Internet cafe as we couldn't upload any pictures using their connection. Also, the laundry was a European washer/dryer, so doing a load of towels took 6+ hours.
reviews.title: Contemporary relaxing beach stay

reviews.text: Location: Well it goes without saying that the location is beautiful. A 10 minute drive out of Dunsborough, located right on Smiths Beach, which is an amazing beach.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great accommodation, stunning views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: We stayed in a 1 Bed Apartment. Very modern styling. Room sizes are huge, living/kitchen space is great and has everything you need for a longer self catered stay. Bathroom was lovely with a large free standing bath, shower to be honest could of been better. Bed was a super king, very firm and comfortable.
reviews.title: Amazing Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our mini honeymoon at Smiths and stayed in room 11, a lovely 2 storey 1 bedroom apartment. Our apartment was very spacious with a large bath, shower and fully equipped kitchen (except no garlic press). The bed was huge and very firm (a little too firm for us but everyone is different here) The design is minimalist which appeared quite cold at first but after a few nights we settled in nicely.
reviews.title: Week of relaxation at Smiths..

reviews.text: The location is just perfect, we had views of the beautiful sunset and a 2 min walk to Smiths Beach offered dolphins and salmon and an even better view. Also just 10 mins from Dunsborough and 30 mins from Margaret River.
reviews.title: Like Center Parcs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lady at reception was very helpful and offered to look up various tourist attractions and draw us maps. However, we were told that Bathers restaurant would be open and when we got there it was shut. We did have one meal at Bouzy (it offered 1 vegetarian option) and that was lovely. But it was disappointing to be told Bathers would be open.
reviews.title: Weekend gateaway at the beach

reviews.text: I agree with the previous quote regarding value: "Overall its good value, not outstanding. Remember that its self catered accommodation. The villas (rooms) are amazing quality, but there are a few areas that need improvement in order to say that its excellent value."
reviews.title: a total rip off - hire a house instead.

reviews.text: The internet was expensive and drops out constantly, I would not recommend using it. We found that we could hear everytime the chairs in the apartment next to us were moved. We also had issues with our tv remote when the battery went dead after dinner. There was nobody around to help and the bar staff could not get hold of the caretaker. This is completely self catered, which is what we were looking for, and we really did enjoy our week there. But to be honest I think there could be more ongoing service given the price.
reviews.title: Don't get mislead - you are not in luxury boutique hotel....
Smiths Beach - Jan 2010
reviews.text: Staff were excellant
Apartment was VERY well equipped and furnished.
reviews.title: fabulous resort in beautiful location

reviews.text: Beach - fantastic.
reviews.title: Luxury Accommodation but Wine Deli a let down during winter!

reviews.text: Also a great base for visiting some of the fantastic vinyards (Voyager).
reviews.title: Lovely, private villas with great views & well-kept amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish we could have stayed longer, much longer!
reviews.title: Contemporary, modern apartment style living with warmth and wonderful location.

reviews.text: Booked x2 beach shacks next to each other as we had 4 adults and 2 kids amongst us. Each beachshack sleeps 6 (queen bed in one room; 2 bunk beds in second room; central bathroom with combined laundry/separate toilet; open plan kitchen/living area). Would be fine with 2 adults and kids, but I think you would feel like you are getting on top of each other if more adults were in the shack. Each beachshack has a car spot at the front and a small courtyard with BBQ, outdoor dining set and clothes line. Appliances all new and in good condition. Modern decor. Flat screen TV and DVD player in each shack. Split air conditioner in each bedroom and living area....which was very much required during the summer days. Lovely pool (and wading pool) for a swim and deck chairs to soak up the sun....is supposed to be heated, but the day we arrived they had just cleaned and refilled it and so was not heated completely yet, but still enjoyed it as it was a warm day. Tennis court also at property. No views from beachshacks. Toiletries provided and towels were white and fluffy and linen beautifully white and crisp. Shacks stocked with ample amount of laundry detergent/dishwashing detergent/vacuum etc for long stays. Real milk (not UHT stuff) also in fridge for arrival. Handheld shower head great for those with kids, no bath tub in shacks, but bubby can be washed in basin. Each beachshack has showers outside for you to wash off sand before entering unit.
reviews.title: Great, relatively new resort

reviews.text: Dined at restaurant in resort, food was pretty good but pricey. Funky bar and shop for you to buy ready made meals (though we didn't try these).
reviews.title: Great Accommodation

likes.liked: — The stylish villas and great nearby beach

reviews.text: Great place to stay to enjoy the beach (Smith's beach is quite rought, Bunker Bay is calmer) and Margaret River region.
reviews.title: Excellent location, lovely hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed when they had special rates on, so at the time it was better value for money. However, would definitely recommend this resort and stay here again.
reviews.title: Housekeeping needs improvement

likes.liked: — Restaurant, Good Location, Good Service in the Restaurant and Front Desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a 3 bedroom beach villa with fantastic views across the Indian Ocean. The accommodation felt like a house and was easily big enough for a family although we were only 3 people so we had ample room.
reviews.title: Relaxing, by a lovely beach

description: Smiths Beach Resort is a resort with a difference - a mix of private self-contained accommodation combined with first-class resort facilities.This is the quintessential Australian beach-side experience encompassing world class facilities and an assortment of food and beverage options operated by Lamont's, one of WA's premier food and wine families. These facilities include restaurant, bar, gourmet deli/cafe and bottleshop, and the only cellar door wine tasting facilities in a resort in the region.Smiths Beach Resort is unlike most resorts in that it offers guests the convenience of fully self-contained accommodation, all with private living areas and kitchen facilities, ideal for those who prefer the option to look after themselves, or these wonderful dining facilities for those who prefer to relax and make the most of being on holiday. As such, Smiths Beach Resort does not offer room service and rooms are are not cleaned daily however additional cleaning can be arranged for those who desire it.Rooms range from comfortable 4-star Beach Shacks for families, to beautiful and very spacious 5-star Apartments, Villas and Beach Houses.A Small Luxury Hotel of the World boarded by the spectacular Smiths Beach and the internationally acclaimed Margaret River Wine Region. The Beach Shacks are not part of the SLH program but guests do have access to all the resort facilities.
